thread.title: Local college roundup: Mitchell men’s soccer gets boost from locals
thread.title_full: Local college roundup: Mitchell men’s soccer gets boost from locals

author: The Bulletin
title: Local college roundup: Mitchell men’s soccer gets boost from locals
text: Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 9:59 PM By The Bulletin Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 9:59 PM NEW LONDON — Norwich Free Academy graduate Andris Vital scored his second goal of the season to help the Mitchell men’s soccer team defeat Johnson State, 5-1, on Wednesday afternoon. Andrew Storton, the boys soccer coach at Bacon Academy, scored his sixth goal of the season — tied with Andrew Nigro for the team lead. Nigro scored two goals for the Mariners (5-5-1), the second of which was assisted by Wheeler alum T.J. Condon and Waterford alum Yianni Longinidis. New London alum Robert Ochoa made six stops. Conn College 1 NEW LONDON — Ryan Murphy made four saves, but the Warriors’ (9-2-1) three-game winning streak ended. UConn 1 Cincinnati 1 (2 OT) STORRS — Abdou Mbacke Thiam scored his team-leading third goal of the season, but the Huskies (3-3-4, 0-2-1 American Athletic Conference) could not hold the lead against the Bearcats. WOMEN’S SOCCER Johnson St. 3 Mitchell 2 (OT) NEW LONDON — Killingly High alum Drew Johndrow scored her first collegiate goal in the Mariners’ (1-5-2) overtime loss. Endicott 4 ECSU 3 BEVERLY, Mass. — Eastern Connecticut State sophomore Emily Becher netted two goals in a span of six minutes in the first half, but Endicott responded with four goals in an eight-minute span to hand the Warriors their first road loss. Becher, of Brooklyn, moved into eighth place on Eastern’s all-time list with the 26th and 27th goals of her career. Becher scored twice off assists from McKenzie Reimondo before Endicott posted the next four goals. FIELD HOCKEY ECSU 2 Fitchburg St. 1 MANSFIELD — Alex Kallgren and Brianna Passero scored less than five minutes apart in the second half to cap a comeback victory for the Warriors. Maddie Larusso made three saves for Eastern Connecticut State (6-4, 4-2 Little East), which has won three of its past four games. By The Bulletin
